Solitary tract nucleus HSD2 neuron.Title: Aldosterone-sensitive neurons in the rat central nervous system
Solitary tract nucleus HSD2 neuron.EditorialNote: Appended Superior colliculus to name given by contributor to conform to Neurolex NIF naming conventions
Solitary tract nucleus HSD2 neuron.Definition: A subgroup of neurons in NTS that express glucocorticoid to inactivating enzyme 11 to beta to hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase type 2 (HSD2), a signature of aldosterone to sensitive tissues. Similar neurons are found in other brain regions.  The NTS population may represent a unique phenotype.
